abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column argues that there is considerable dissonance between Newark Mayor Cory A Booker’s national and local reputations; holds that narrative of his heroic, self-sacrificing campaign to redeem a city plagued by violence and poverty has been tarnished at the local level by scandal, layoffs, rising crime and a broken budget.
snippet: The dissonance between Mayor Cory A. Booker’s national and local reputations is considerable. Closer to Newark, his difficulties look self-inflicted.
lead_paragraph: The dissonance between Mayor Cory A. Booker’s national and local reputations is considerable. Closer to Newark, his difficulties look self-inflicted.

headline.main: Back Home, a Mayor’s Sparkle Has Begun to Dim
headline.seo: Newark’s Troubles Dim Mayor Cory A. Booker’s Star
headline.print_headline: Back Home, a Mayor’s Sparkle Has Begun to Dim
